content.question: Id hoc facilius eis persuasit, quod undique loci natura Helvetii continentur: una ex parte flumine Rheno latissimo atque altissimo, qui agrum Helvetium a Germanis dividit; altera ex parte monte Iura altissimo, qui est inter Sequanos et Helvetios; tertia lacu Lemanno et flumine Rhodano, qui provinciam nostram ab Helvetiis dividit. His 5rebus fiebat ut et minus late vagarentur et minus facile finitimis bellum inferre possent: qua ex parte homines bellandi cupidi magno dolore adficiebantur. Bellum Gallicum 1. 2 Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question. 1. What are the case and use of loci (line 1)? 2. In lines 1-4 (una . . . ab Helvetiis dividit), which two Latin words describe the dimensions of a river? 3. Identify the two nouns in this passage that are ablatives of separation. 4. In lines 1-4 (una . . . ab Helvetiis dividit), which three Latin words can be translated “from another side”? 5. What are the case and use of His rebus (lines 4-5) ? 6. In lines 4-6 (His . . . possent), which three Latin words indicate that the Helvetians’ ability to travel was restricted? 7. (A) Which Latin word is the subject of adficiebantur (line 6) and (B) to whom or what does that subject refer? 8. (A) What are the case and number of cupidi (line 6) ? (B) Translate it in context with the noun it modifies. 9. When Caesar eliminates one of the communities of the Helvetian people, he justifies it in Book 1 by claiming what about that group of people? Answer in 1-2 complete sentences.
